div.p: Survival probability in relation to basal metabolic rate between years. Survival of blue tits from the winters 2004/2005 (A) and 2005/2006 (B) until the next breeding season, as a function of BMR (basal metabolic rate). Squares represent actual survival (1 = survived). The lines represent survival probabilities for residual BMR (cubic splines, thick solid line ± SE, broken line) controlling for the effects of respirometer channel (random factor) and mass (covariate).
